title: Gamaliel Díaz
text:
Gamaliel Díaz Magaña (born 14 February 1981) is a <a href="Mexican%20people">Mexican</a> professional <a href="Boxing">boxer</a> who held the <a href="World%20Boxing%20Council">WBC</a> super featherweight title from 2012 to 2013.
Professional career.
In December 2005, Díaz upset the undefeated <a href="Mexican%20American">Mexican American</a> future champion, <a href="Robert%20Guerrero">Robert Guerrero</a>, to win the <a href="North%20American%20Boxing%20Federation">NABF</a> <a href="Featherweight">Featherweight</a> Championship. He was defeated by Guerrero in a rematch by 6th round knockout.
He defeated future champion <a href="Elio%20Rojas">Elio Rojas</a> by split decision, handing the Dominican fighter his first loss, in a WBC Featherweight Title Eliminator. On December 15, 2007, he faced WBC Featherweight champion <a href="Jorge%20Linares">Jorge Linares</a>, but was defeated by 8th round knockout.
On October 11, 2008 Gamaliel lost to <a href="World%20Boxing%20Council">Interim WBC</a> <a href="Super%20Featherweight">Super Featherweight</a> Champion, <a href="Mexican%20people">Mexican</a> <a href="Humberto%20Soto">Humberto Soto</a>. The bout was at the Auditorio Centenario in <a href="Torre%C3%B3n">Torreón</a>, <a href="Coahuila">Coahuila</a>, Mexico.
After scoring 13 consecutive victories, Diaz challenged WBC Super Featherweight champion <a href="Takahiro%20Ao">Takahiro Ao</a> in his hometown of <a href="Tokyo">Tokyo</a>, on December 27, 2012. As an underdog, he defeated the Japanese champion in a 12 round unanimous decision to claim the title.
